intro: Heterosamara isocarpa, commonly known as the mountain pepper, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its native ecosystems.
